Package main

Class CaesarCracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.CaesarCracker
  • public class CaesarCracker
extends java.lang.Object
    Brute force cracker for keyed Caesar encoding.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int NUMCODES
      Number of character codes (0..NUMCODES-1).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CaesarCracker()
      Default constructor.
      CaesarCracker​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String word)
      Constructor that receives both known message word and encrypted message.

      Returns the key found by the last brute force decryption.

    • Field Detail

      • NUMCODES

        public static final int NUMCODES
        Number of character codes (0..NUMCODES-1). Number 128 corresponds to standard ASCII.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaesarCracker

        public CaesarCracker()
        Default constructor. Sets both known message word and encrypted message to "". Maximum password length to be tried is set to 1.

      • CaesarCracker

        public CaesarCracker​(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.String word)
        Constructor that receives both known message word and encrypted message. Maximum password length to be tried is set to 1.
        Parameters:
        message - is the encrypted message to work on.
        word - is the word known to belong to the decrypted message.

    • Method Detail

      • getPasswordLength

        public final int getPasswordLength()
        Returns the maximum length to be tried in password cracking. For instance, if such length is 1, then all passwords of length 1 (values from 0 to NUMCODES-1) will be tried as passwords for cracking.
        Returns:
        the maximum length to be tried for password cracking.

      • setPasswordLength

        public final void setPasswordLength​(int length)
        Sets the maximum length of the password to be tried for deciphering the encrypted message.
        Parameters:
        length - is the new maximum length for the passwords to try for cracking.

      • getMessageWord

        public final java.lang.String getMessageWord()
        Returns the known word of the message previous to encryption. This word is used to test whether a given password is able to decrypt the encrypted message.
        Returns:
        the known word of the unencrypted message.

      • setMessageWord

        public final void setMessageWord​(java.lang.String word)
        Sets the known word from the unencrypted message. A valid decryption will be one that, applied to the encrypted message leads to an unencrypted message containing the known word.
        Parameters:
        word - is the known word from the unencrypted message.

      • getEncryptedMessage

        public final java.lang.String getEncryptedMessage()
        Returns the encrypted message, that to be cracked.
        Returns:
        the encrypted message.

      • setEncryptedMessage

        public final void setEncryptedMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the encrypted message, to be "decrypted" by brute force.
        Parameters:
        message - is the encrypted message to set for the cracker.

      • encode

        public static java.lang.String encode​(java.lang.String message,
                                      int[] key)
        Encodes message with a given key.
        Parameters:
        message - is the message to be encoded.
        key - is the key used for encoding, given as an array of integer values (from 0 to NUMCODES-1).
        Returns:
        the message encoded with the provided key.

      • decode

        public static java.lang.String decode​(java.lang.String message,
                                      int[] key)
        Decodes message with a given key.
        Parameters:
        message - is the message to be decoded.
        key - is the key used for decoding, given as an array of integer values (from 0 to NUMCODES-1).
        Returns:
        the message decoded with the provided key.

      • bruteForceDecrypt

        public final boolean bruteForceDecrypt()
        Attempts to decode encrypted message with the given key. Brute force decryption tries to find a key of at most this.passwordLength values (each from 0 to NUMCODES-1) such that the decryption of the encrypted message leads to a decrypted text that contains this.messageWord.
        Returns:
        true iff brute force decryption succeeded.

      • foundKey

        public final int[] foundKey()
        Returns the key found by the last brute force decryption. Method returns null if brute force decryption was never executed, or if key was not found.
        Returns:
        key found by brute force decryption (null if not found / decryption not executed)

      • isPureAscii

        public static boolean isPureAscii​(java.lang.String s)
        Tests whether a string is pure ascii.
        Parameters:
        s - is the string being analyzed
        Returns:
        true iff s is pure ascii
